title: Five-Number Summary and Outlier Detection
driving_question: How can we use the five-number summary and outlier detection methods to analyze a dataset?
short_background_context: Students calculate five-number summaries and detect outliers in hospital stay data using two statistical methods (IQR and SD).
pre_thinking_prompts: What ideas or thoughts come to mind?

tasks.task_text: Calculate the five-number summary for hospital stay data.
tasks.hint: Remember: min, Q1, median, Q3, max.

tasks.task_text: Identify outliers using Method A (IQR rule).
tasks.hint: Outliers lie beyond 1.5 * IQR above Q3 or below Q1.

tasks.task_text: Identify outliers using Method B (Standard Deviation method).
tasks.hint: Outliers are more than 2 SD away from the mean.

reflection_prompt: How do different outlier detection methods change how you view a dataset?
remix_zone: Students remix by analyzing new datasets: student test scores, local health data, environmental data.

title: Analyzing Senator Bernie Sanders's Tax Plan
driving_question: How would Senator Bernie Sanders's proposed tax plan impact the economy, specifically high-income households, and healthcare?
short_background_context: Students study projected impacts of Sanders's tax reforms, including GDP changes, tax revenue increases, and healthcare premium models.
pre_thinking_prompts: What ideas or thoughts come to mind?

tasks.task_text: Summarize key tax code changes proposed by Sanders.
tasks.hint: Focus on marginal tax rates, payroll taxes, and healthcare financing.

tasks.task_text: Model projected revenue increase and GDP decrease mathematically.
tasks.hint: Use percent change formulas and growth/decrease modeling.

tasks.task_text: Evaluate effects of the new healthcare premium on different income groups.
tasks.hint: Compare fixed premiums vs. income-based tax models.

reflection_prompt: How can tax policy shape economic opportunity and health access?
remix_zone: Students remix by comparing Sanders's plan to other tax models globally.

title: Transforming Learning Through Technology
driving_question: How can we leverage technology to enhance our learning and understanding in various subjects?
short_background_context: Students apply ISTE standards to set learning goals, seek feedback, and reflect on technology-enhanced growth across subjects.
pre_thinking_prompts: What ideas or thoughts come to mind?

tasks.task_text: Set technology-enhanced learning goals per subject.
tasks.hint: Define clear targets using technology tools (e.g., collaboration platforms, data analysis software).

tasks.task_text: Seek feedback and demonstrate learning improvements using tech.
tasks.hint: Collect evidence of feedback loops and iterations.
Experiment with new tools and document challenges and solutions.

reflection_prompt: How has technology empowered you to learn more deeply or broadly?
remix_zone: Students remix by designing a technology-enhanced learning plan for arts, activism, or community work.

title: Bias in Data Collection: A Case Study in Activity Tracking
driving_question: How can bias be introduced in data collection and how can it be mitigated?
short_background_context: Students study bias risks when comparing self-reported data vs. device-tracked activity logs, designing improved experimental setups.
pre_thinking_prompts: What ideas or thoughts come to mind?

tasks.task_text: Identify biases in self-reporting vs. device tracking.
tasks.hint: Consider memory errors, over-reporting, and under-reporting biases.

tasks.task_text: Design an experiment comparing the two.
tasks.hint: Control for sample size, environment, and measurement tools.

tasks.task_text: Discuss ethical implications of different data collection methods.
tasks.hint: Balance participant privacy with research needs.

reflection_prompt: How can thinking carefully about bias and ethics improve research quality?
remix_zone: Students remix by analyzing bias in nutrition studies, gaming behavior, or education research.

title: Historical Redlining and Modern Housing Instability
driving_question: How does the historical redlining practice in the United States impact current housing instability?
short_background_context: Students explore the correlation between historical redlining maps and modern housing instability indicators. They propose targeted policy interventions.
pre_thinking_prompts: What ideas or thoughts come to mind?

tasks.task_text: Analyze correlation between redlining patterns and housing instability.
tasks.hint: Overlay historical redlining maps with modern eviction, poverty, or foreclosure data.

tasks.task_text: Evaluate targeted emergency rental assistance as a policy solution.
tasks.hint: Assess strengths and weaknesses of emergency rent relief programs.

tasks.task_text: Propose an alternative policy or intervention to address housing instability.
tasks.hint: Think about affordability, tenant protections, or community land trusts.

reflection_prompt: How has studying redlining shifted your understanding of housing justice?
